<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/filewriter">FileWriter</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/outputaggregator">OutputAggregator</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// GsymCreator is used to emit GSYM data to a stand alone file or section</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// within a file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The GsymCreator is designed to be used in 3 stages:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Create FunctionInfo objects and add them</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Finalize the GsymCreator object</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// - Save to file or section</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The first stage involves creating FunctionInfo objects from another source</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of information like compiler debug info metadata, DWARF or Breakpad files.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Any strings in the FunctionInfo or contained information, like InlineInfo</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// or LineTable objects, should get the string table offsets by calling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// GsymCreator::insertString(...). Any file indexes that are needed should be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// obtained by calling GsymCreator::insertFile(...). All of the function calls</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in GsymCreator are thread safe. This allows multiple threads to create and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// add FunctionInfo objects while parsing debug information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Once all of the FunctionInfo objects have been added, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// GsymCreator::finalize(...) must be called prior to saving. This function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// will sort the FunctionInfo objects, finalize the string table, and do any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// other passes on the information needed to prepare the information to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// saved.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Once the object has been finalized, it can be saved to a file or section.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ENCODING</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// GSYM files are designed to be memory mapped into a process as shared, read</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// only data, and used as is.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The GSYM file format when in a stand alone file consists of:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - Header</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - Address Table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - Function Info Offsets</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - File Table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - String Table</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - Function Info Data</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// HEADER</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The header is fully described in &quot;llvm/DebugInfo/GSYM/Header.h&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ADDRESS TABLE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The address table immediately follows the header in the file and consists</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of Header.NumAddresses address offsets. These offsets are sorted and can be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// binary searched for efficient lookups. Addresses in the address table are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// stored as offsets from a 64 bit base address found in Header.BaseAddress.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This allows the address table to contain 8, 16, or 32 offsets. This allows</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the address table to not require full 64 bit addresses for each address.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The resulting GSYM size is smaller and causes fewer pages to be touched</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// during address lookups when the address table is smaller. The size of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// address offsets in the address table is specified in the header in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Header.AddrOffSize. The first offset in the address table is aligned to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Header.AddrOffSize alignment to ensure efficient access when loaded into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// memory.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FUNCTION INFO OFFSETS TABLE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The function info offsets table immediately follows the address table and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// consists of Header.NumAddresses 32 bit file offsets: one for each address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in the address table. This data is aligned to a 4 byte boundary. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// offsets in this table are the relative offsets from the start offset of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// GSYM header and point to the function info data for each address in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// address table. Keeping this data separate from the address table helps to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// reduce the number of pages that are touched when address lookups occur on a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// GSYM file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FILE TABLE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The file table immediately follows the function info offsets table. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// encoding of the FileTable is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// struct FileTable &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   uint32&#95;t Count;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   FileEntry Files&#91;&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The file table starts with a 32 bit count of the number of files that are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// used in all of the function info, followed by that number of FileEntry</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// structures. The file table is aligned to a 4 byte boundary, Each file in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the file table is represented with a FileEntry structure.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// See &quot;llvm/DebugInfo/GSYM/FileEntry.h&quot; for details.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// STRING TABLE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The string table follows the file table in stand alone GSYM files and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// contains all strings for everything contained in the GSYM file. Any string</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// data should be added to the string table and any references to strings</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// inside GSYM information must be stored as 32 bit string table offsets into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// this string table. The string table always starts with an empty string at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// offset zero and is followed by any strings needed by the GSYM information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The start of the string table is not aligned to any boundary.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FUNCTION INFO DATA</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The function info data is the payload that contains information about the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// address that is being looked up. It contains all of the encoded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FunctionInfo objects. Each encoded FunctionInfo&#39;s data is pointed to by an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// entry in the Function Info Offsets Table. For details on the exact encoding</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of FunctionInfo objects, see &quot;llvm/DebugInfo/GSYM/FunctionInfo.h&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/gsymcreator"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/gsymcreator/#af85ae9f6e8c014d57c9b61519dcadcbd">GsymCreator</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Private member variables require Mutex protections</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">mutable</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::mutex Mutex;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;FunctionInfo&gt; Funcs;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringtablebuilder">StringTableBuilder</a> StrTab;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringset">StringSet&lt;&gt;</a> StringStorage;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;llvm::gsym::FileEntry, uint32&#95;t&gt;</a> FileEntryToIndex;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Needed for mapping string offsets back to the string stored in \\a StrTab.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;uint64&#95;t, CachedHashStringRef&gt;</a> StringOffsetMap;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;llvm::gsym::FileEntry&gt; Files;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::vector&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/textapi/textstubcommon-h/#a847f9d797fd06f1d451476d6362a6a41">UUID</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Save this GSYM file into segments that are roughly \\a SegmentSize in size.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// When segemented GSYM files are saved to disk, they will use \\a Path as a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// prefix and then have the first function info address appended to the path</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// when each segment is saved. Each segmented GSYM file has a only the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// strings and files that are needed to save the function infos that are in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// each segment. These smaller files are easy to compress and download</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// separately and allow for efficient lookups with very large GSYM files and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// segmenting them allows servers to download only the segments that are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// needed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param Path The path prefix to use when saving the GSYM files.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param ByteOrder The endianness to use when saving the file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param SegmentSize The size in bytes to segment the GSYM file into.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">llvm::Error</a> saveSegments(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Path, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae1e26e57357947b25e392fd18ab000db">llvm::endianness</a> ByteOrder,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlight">                           uint64&#95;t SegmentSize) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// When we have a segment, we know that function infos will be added in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ascending address range order without having to be finalized. We also</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// don&#39;t need to sort and unique entries during the finalize function call.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Save a GSYM file to a stand alone file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param Path The file path to save the GSYM file to.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param ByteOrder The endianness to use when saving the file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param SegmentSize The size in bytes to segment the GSYM file into. If</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                    this option is set this function will create N segments</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                    that are all around \\a SegmentSize bytes in size. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                    allows a very large GSYM file to be broken up into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                    shards. Each GSYM file will have its own file table,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                    and string table that only have the files and strings</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                    needed for the shared. If this argument has no value,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                    a single GSYM file that contains all function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                    information will be created.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\returns An error object that indicates success or failure of the save.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">llvm::Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/gsymcreator/#a5c4f8122cf59952849b4d8184df118dc">save</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Path, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae1e26e57357947b25e392fd18ab000db">llvm::endianness</a> ByteOrder,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Check if an address is a valid code address.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Any functions whose addresses do not exist within these function bounds</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// will not be converted into the final GSYM. This allows the object file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to figure out the valid file address ranges of all the code sections</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and ensure we don&#39;t add invalid functions to the final output. Many</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// linkers have issues when dead stripping functions from DWARF debug info</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// where they set the DW&#95;AT&#95;low&#95;pc to zero, but newer DWARF has the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DW&#95;AT&#95;high&#95;pc as an offset from the DW&#95;AT&#95;low&#95;pc and these size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// attributes have no relocations that can be applied. This results in DWARF</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// where many functions have an DW&#95;AT&#95;low&#95;pc of zero and a valid offset size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// for DW&#95;AT&#95;high&#95;pc. If we extract all valid ranges from an object file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// that are marked with executable permissions, we can properly ensure that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// these functions are removed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param Addr An address to check.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\returns True if the address is in the valid text ranges or if no valid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///          text ranges have been set, false otherwise.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/gsymcreator/#aed7eb12c998221cb39a6a3d96e9a0e56">IsValidTextAddress</a>(uint64&#95;t Addr) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Set the base address to use for the GSYM file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Setting the base address to use for the GSYM file. Object files typically</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// get loaded from a base address when the OS loads them into memory. Using</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// GSYM files for symbolication becomes easier if the base address in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// GSYM header is the same address as it allows addresses to be easily slid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and allows symbolication without needing to find the original base</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// address in the original object file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param  Addr The address to use as the base address of the GSYM file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///              when it is saved to disk.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/gsymcreator/#a3a20d5b08d026255dd9f7f7473cfe89b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/gsymcreator/#a3a20d5b08d026255dd9f7f7473cfe89b">setBaseAddress</a>(uint64&#95;t Addr) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><span class="doxyHighlight">    BaseAddress = Addr;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Whether the transformation should be quiet, i.e. not output warnings.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/gsymcreator/#aaf2698c4afe7c309bcae39e29649586b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/gsymcreator/#aaf2698c4afe7c309bcae39e29649586b">isQuiet</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a0d9d5328bc7a7ba4906fb7a366cc9a32a098753f8980036f4b936e3d4b6997111">Quiet</a>; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Create a segmented GSYM creator starting with function info index</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\a FuncIdx.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This function will create a GsymCreator object that will encode into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// roughly \\a SegmentSize bytes and return it. It is used by the private</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// saveSegments(...) function and also is used by the GSYM unit tests to test</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// segmenting of GSYM files. The returned GsymCreator can be finalized and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// encoded.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param &#91;in&#93; SegmentSize The size in bytes to roughly segment the GSYM file</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// into.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param &#91;in,out&#93; FuncIdx The index of the first function info to encode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// into the returned GsymCreator. This index will be updated so it can be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// used in subsequent calls to this function to allow more segments to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// created.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\returns An expected unique pointer to a GsymCreator or an error. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// returned unique pointer can be NULL if there are no more functions to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// encode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">llvm::Expected&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;GsymCreator&gt;</a>&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/gsymcreator/#a5a00b6c05d78359948c41de0ee1f20a4">createSegment</a>(uint64&#95;t SegmentSize, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;FuncIdx) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
